Description: Acacia(?) wood shabti originally covered with a layer of painted, gilded and plastered linen(now mostly missing); features include a lappet wig, a carved face, a gold collar, arms in relief with the hands holding two hoes, the legs and feet are inscribed with Chapter 6 of The Book of the Dead in thirteen rows of incised hieroglyphs from which the owner's name has been erased, the back has the remains of seed-basket.
